{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3425960,"name":"Hamad","username":"Hamad_M","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hamad_m/{size}/232815_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-21T23:23:26.608Z","cooked":"

Hi, I have been trying to get autonomous to work using PathPlanner. I am relatively new to programming for FIRST. I don’t know where the problem lies, the autonomous is really inconsistent sometimes it works and scores but other times it’s way off. I don’t know if it is bad PID values or if I missed something. GitHub - NotBip/Team5870-2025. Here is our github I remade Deep Dive. also I would like some advice on how to tune PID Values for swerve drive, so if someone could help with that too I would appreciate it. I have an example of the autonomous we used for crescendo in the code to show how we tried doing it

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-09-21T23:31:28.056Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":112.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471628,"topic_slug":"need-help-programming-autonomous-using-pathplanner","display_username":"Hamad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/NotBip/Team5870-2025","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - NotBip/Team5870-2025","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68023,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/need-help-programming-autonomous-using-pathplanner/471628/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3426024,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-22T07:59:12.116Z","cooked":"
Hamad_M:

also I would like some advice on how to tune PID Values for swerve drive

A good starting point is running sysid for your drivetrain, which will provide a solid baseline for your gains. From there, you can follow WPILib’s guide to tuning PIDs to fine-tune the values.

Hamad_M:

but other times it’s way off

It would be helpful if you could share a video of your robot running those “way off” autonomous modes, along with some log files. This will give others more context to infer what might be going wrong.

Additionally, double-check if the auto really fails randomly, or if there are specific conditions associated with the failure, such as being on the Red Alliance side or when the battery is low.

I would start with comparing what the robot does for real with what the odometry thinks it is doing.

Having a dashboard functioning with a robot plot working on a field widget allows you to trouble shoot effectively.

I think glass is probably the fastest/easiest place to start…

Its in the SwerveSubsystem file on github if u wanna take a look too.

Yes, you need to align the wheels and without using heading optimization. Otherwise your modules may be 180 degrees offset and make some nice holes in your carpet

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-09-23T03:31:30.878Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":47,"readers_count":46,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471628,"topic_slug":"need-help-programming-autonomous-using-pathplanner","display_username":"Sam Carlberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61239,"username":"AvocadoPeel","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avocadopeel/{size}/232401_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25916,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2084 Lead Mentor | WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/need-help-programming-autonomous-using-pathplanner/471628/8","custom_user_title":"2084 Lead Mentor | WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3426302,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-23T05:44:14.265Z","cooked":"

Please don’t run that test! You would want to have the swerve modules aligned before running drive voltage.

Also, for a swerve, we usually run SysId by rotating it because you won’t run into walls.

You can try this:

public Command sysIdQuasistatic(SysIdRoutine.Direction direction) {
  return Commands.run(() -> setModuleStates(DriveConstantrs.kDriveKinematics.toSwerveModuleStates(new ChassisSpeeds(0, 0, 0.01))), this)
    .withTimeOut(1)
    .andThen(routine.quasistatic(direction));
}

And comment this line out in Team5870-2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/Subsystems/SwerveModule.java at main · NotBip/Team5870-2025 · GitHub

// state = SwerveModuleState.optimize(state, getState().angle);

Otherwise, your wheels will run in different directions.

After running sysId you can un-comment it.
